com.github.lwhite1.tablesaw.io.csv

Class CsvReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.lwhite1.tablesaw.io.csv.CsvReader

  • @Immutable
public final class CsvReader
extends Object
    Static utility class that Builds Tables from Comma Separated Value (CSV) files.

    TODO(lwhite): Change header param from a boolean to an int, representing the number of lines for the header TODO(lwhite): Add multi-file read methods that take header, separator, and maybe, wanted as params

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Table detectedColumnTypes(String csvFileName, boolean header, char delimiter)
      Returns the structure of the table given by csvFileName as detected by analysis of a sample of the data
      static Table headerOnly(ColumnType[] types, boolean header, char columnSeparator, String fileName)
      Returns a Relation constructed from a CSV File with the given file name
      static String printColumnTypes(String csvFileName, boolean header, char delimiter)
      Returns a string representation of the file types in file csvFilename, as determined by the type-detection algorithm This method is intended to help analysts quickly fix any erroneous types, by printing out the types in a format such that they can be edited to correct any mistakes, and used in an array literal For example: LOCAL_DATE, // 0 date SHORT_INT, // 1 approval CATEGORY, // 2 who Note that the types are array separated, and that the index position and the column name are printed such that they would be interpreted as comments if you paste the output into an array: ColumnType[] types = { LOCAL_DATE, // 0 date SHORT_INT, // 1 approval CATEGORY, // 2 who }
      static Table read(ColumnType[] types, boolean header, char columnSeparator, String fileName)
      Returns a Relation constructed from a CSV File with the given file name
      static Table read(ColumnType[] types, boolean header, int[] wanted, char columnSeparator, String fileName)
      Returns a Relation constructed from a CSV File.

      Returns a Relation constructed from a CSV File.

      Constructs a Table from a CSV file.

      Constructs and returns a table from one or more CSV files, all containing the same column types

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public static Table read(ColumnType[] types,
                         String... fileNames)
                  throws IOException
        Constructs and returns a table from one or more CSV files, all containing the same column types

        This constructor assumes the files have a one-line header, which is used to populate the column names, and that they use a comma to separate between columns.

        Throws:
        IOException - If there is an issue reading any of the files

      • read

        public static Table read(ColumnType[] types,
                         char delimiter,
                         String fileName)
                  throws IOException
        Constructs a Table from a CSV file. This constructor assumes that the file has a one-line header, which is used to populate the column names.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        public static Table read(ColumnType[] types,
                         boolean header,
                         String fileName)
                  throws IOException
        Returns a Relation constructed from a CSV File.
        Parameters:
        types - An array of the types of columns in the file, in the order they appear
        header - Is the first row in the file a header?
        fileName - The fully specified file name
        Returns:
        A Relation containing the data in the csv file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        public static Table read(ColumnType[] types,
                         boolean header,
                         int[] wanted,
                         char columnSeparator,
                         String fileName)
                  throws IOException
        Returns a Relation constructed from a CSV File.
        Parameters:
        types - An array of the types of columns in the file, in the order they appear
        header - Is the first row in the file a header?
        columnSeparator - The character used to separate the columns in the input file
        fileName - The fully specified file name
        Returns:
        A Relation containing the data in the csv file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        public static Table read(ColumnType[] types,
                         boolean header,
                         char columnSeparator,
                         String fileName)
                  throws IOException
        Returns a Relation constructed from a CSV File with the given file name

        The @code{fileName} is used as the initial table name for the new table

        Parameters:
        types - An array of the types of columns in the file, in the order they appear
        header - Is the first row in the file a header?
        columnSeparator - the delimiter
        fileName - The fully specified file name. It is used to provide a default name for the table
        Returns:
        A Relation containing the data in the csv file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • headerOnly

                               String fileName)

        Returns a Relation constructed from a CSV File with the given file name

        The @code{fileName} is used as the initial table name for the new table

        Parameters:

        header - Is the first row in the file a header?
        columnSeparator - the delimiter
        fileName - The fully specified file name. It is used to provide a default name for the table
        Returns:
        A Relation containing the data in the csv file.
        Throws:

        public static Table detectedColumnTypes(String csvFileName,
                                        boolean header,
                                        char delimiter)
                                 throws IOException
        Returns the structure of the table given by csvFileName as detected by analysis of a sample of the data
        Throws:

      • printColumnTypes

        public static String printColumnTypes(String csvFileName,
                                      boolean header,
                                      char delimiter)
                               throws IOException
        Returns a string representation of the file types in file csvFilename, as determined by the type-detection algorithm This method is intended to help analysts quickly fix any erroneous types, by printing out the types in a format such that they can be edited to correct any mistakes, and used in an array literal For example: LOCAL_DATE, // 0 date SHORT_INT, // 1 approval CATEGORY, // 2 who Note that the types are array separated, and that the index position and the column name are printed such that they would be interpreted as comments if you paste the output into an array: ColumnType[] types = { LOCAL_DATE, // 0 date SHORT_INT, // 1 approval CATEGORY, // 2 who }
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        public static Table read(String fileName)
                  throws IOException
        Retuns the given file after autodetecting the column types, or trying to
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to load
        Returns:
        A table containing the data from the file
        Throws:
        IOException
